1 Introduction¶

This document describes the Intermediate Operation Model format of the Language Ecosystem for Modeling Microservice Archictecture. The project aims to facilitate the development of microservice-based software systems [New15] by employing Model-driven Development (MDD) [CFJezequel+17].

In this context, a microservice architecture consists of several different types of models, listed in Table 1.

Table 1 Model types¶

Model Type

Description

Domain Data Model

A Domain Data Model describes the domain-specific data used by a modeled microservice to specify its input/output data. See also the Intermediate Data Model Format Specification.

Mapping Model

A Mapping Model allows for assigning (alternative) technologies to, e.g., modeled microservices in a Service Model and complex types in a Data Model.

Service Model

A Service Model contains several microservice models, their interfaces, and operations. The contents of imported Domain Data Models, e.g., data structures, may be used to type operations’ parameters. See also the Intermediate Service Model Format Specification.

Operation Model

An Operation Model expresses the deployment and operation of microservices being imported from Service Models, and the dependencies to infrastructure nodes, e.g., databases or service discoveries, being imported from Operation Models.

Technology Model

A Technology models encapsulates descriptions of technologies. For instance, certain implementation technologies, e.g., Java or Go, and protocol technologies, e.g., REST or AMQP, may be contained in a Technology Model. Moreover, service or operation aspects [KLM+97] may be defined, which enable to reify technology specifications in Mapping, Operation, or Service Models.

2 Model Processing¶

The creation of the models happens within a bundle of Eclipse 1 plugins that are based on Xcore 2 and Xtext 3. These technologies build upon the Ecore metamodeling standard [SBPM11] and the Eclipse Modeling Framework (EMF) 4.

However, to detach the processing of the models from the Eclipse ecosystem and allow microservice teams for creating custom model processors like validators and code generators [CFJezequel+17] that do not need to depend on EMF, the models are exported 5 from Eclipse to the technology-agnostic XML Metadata Interchange (XMI) format 6.

XMI is based on XML and encodes a model instance, whose metamodel [CFJezequel+17] is based on the Meta Object Facility (MOF) 7 which is generally the case for Ecore metamodels and derived model instances.

3 Format Specification¶

This document describes the metamodel and thus the structure of XMI files of Intermediate Operation Models, i.e., instances of Operation Models that were exported from Eclipse (cf. 1   Introduction and 2   Model Processing). It may be used as reference, when implementing custom model processors for microservice-related Operation Models.

Fig. 1 shows the structure of the metamodel of the Intermediate Operation Models in an object-oriented way in the form of a UML class diagram. The modeling concepts, their properties, and relationships are depicted as classes, attributes, and associations, respectively.

Fig. 1 Metamodel of Intermediate Operation Models¶

In the following, the document contains a reference of each modeling concept of the metamodel depicted in Fig. 1.

Hint

Attributes that may contain more than one value but exhibit a * multiplicity, i.e., they may contain an arbitrary number of values or even none at all (* is shorthand UML notation for 0..*), are never null.

In case no multiplicity is stated after the object type of an attribute, the attribute may be null. For example, an attribute defined as String name implicitly has a multiplicity 0..1 and in the zero-case the String may be null.

However, in case the attribute’s type is a built-in primitive Java type, e.g. int, the attribute will never be null but exhibits the type’s default value in case it did not receive an explicit value.

3.1 Model Root¶

class IntermediateOperationModel¶

Root of the Intermediate Operation Model instance.

String[1] sourceModelUri

“file” URI pointing to the source Operation Model file from which this model was derived.

Note

Model processors must not depend on this URI being absolute or relative. Both cases may occur in practice and are totally up to the modeler.

IntermediateImport[*] imports

References to data_model:IntermediateDataModel or Technology Model (cf. Table 1) instances that were imported into the source Operation Model (cf. data_model:IntermediateImport).

IntermediateContainer[*] containers

Modeled containers in the source Operation Model.

Hint

The source Operation Model must not be empty. Consequent, both the containers and infrastructureNodes attributes of an Intermediate Operation Model instance may never be empty at the same time.

IntermediateInfrastructureNode[*] infrastructureNodes

Modeled infrastructure nodes in the source Operation Model.

Hint

The source Operation Model must not be empty. Consequent, both the containers and infrastructureNodes attributes of an Intermediate Operation Model instance may never be empty at the same time.

3.2 Operation Nodes¶

class IntermediateOperationNode¶

Abstract super class of IntermediateContainer and IntermediateInfrastructureNode.

String[1] name

Unique name of the operation node.

getEffectiveConfigurationValues(service : OperationMicroserviceReference) → IntermediateTechnologySpecificPropertyValue[*]¶

Helper to return the effective configuration values on the operation node being set for the given OperationMicroserviceReference. The effective configuration values consist of the default values for the technology-specific properties on the node and the property values specific to the service’s deployment. The latter ones may overwrite the default values.

IntermediateImport[1..*] imports

References to Technology Model (cf. Table 1) instances that were imported into the source Operation Model (cf. data_model:IntermediateImport).

IntermediateOperationEnvironment[1] operationEnvironment

Intermediate representation of the node’s operation environment.

OperationMicroserviceReference[*] deployedServices

References to the microservices being associated with the node.

Note

Despite the name “deployedServices”, this attribute also concerns the microservices that use the node, in case the concrete instance of the node is an IntermediateInfrastructureNode.

IntermediateOperationEndpoint[1..*] endpoints

Intermediate representations of the node’s endpoints.

IntermediateServiceDeploymentSpecification[*] specifications

Intermediate representations of service-specific deployment specifications for services being associated with the node.

IntermediateTechnologySpecificPropertyValue[*] defaultValues

Default values for technology-specific configuration property values. These values account all services being associated with the node.

Hint

You may use the getEffectiveConfigurationValues method to retrieve the effective configuration values of a given associated service.

IntermediateImportedAspect[*] aspects

Intermediate representations of aspects being imported from Technology Models (cf. Table 1) and applied to the node.

class IntermediateOperationEndpoint¶

Intermediate representation of an endpoint on an IntermediateOperationNode. This representation extends the service_model:IntermediateEndpoint concept from the Intermediate Service Model specification by the endpoint’s technology.

IntermediateOperationEndpoint[*] endpointTechnology

Technology used by the endpoint.

IntermediateOperationNode[1] node

Operation node for which the endpoint was specified.

class IntermediateEndpointTechnology¶

Intermediate representation of the technology used by an IntermediateOperationEndpoint. This representation derives from the service_model:IntermediateTechnology concept of the Intermediate Service Model specification to make endpoint technology information specific to Operation Models.

IntermediateOperationEndpoint[1] endpoint

The endpoint to which this technology was assigned.

class IntermediateTechnologySpecificPropertyValue¶

Represents the value of a technology-specific property.

String[1] value

The value of the property.

Hint

The value is represented as a String, but will always be compatible to the type of the IntermediateTechnologySpecificProperty.

IntermediateTechnologySpecificProperty[1] technologySpecificProperty

The IntermediateTechnologySpecificProperty to which the value was assigned.

IntermediateServiceDeploymentSpecification specification

The service deployment specification being configured by this value.

IntermediateOperationNode operationNode

The operation node being configured by this value.

class IntermediateContainer¶

This class represents a container as a certain kind of operation node.

IntermediateDeploymentTechnologyReference[1] technologyReference

Intermediate representation of the reference to the deployment technology being used by the container.

IntermediateOperationModel[1] operationModel

The operation model to which the container belongs.

IntermediateOperationNodeReference[*] dependsOnNodes

A container may depend on other nodes, e.g., databases or service discoveries that deployed microservices require.

IntermediateOperationNodeReference[*] usedByNodes

A container may be used by other nodes that make use of its infrastructure-related capabilities.

Note

The “usedByNodes” attribute models the dependency of another node on a container. The dependsOnNodes attribute takes the opposite perspective and reflects the dependency of a container on another node.

class IntermediateInfrastructureNode¶

This class represents an infrastructure node as a certain kind of operation node.

String qualifiedInfrastructureTechnologyName

Qualified infrastructure technology name, which is used by the infrastructure node.

IntermediateOperationNodeReference[*] dependsOnNodes

An infrastructure node may depend on other nodes, e.g., service discoveries or databases, for its intended functioning.

IntermediateOperationNodeReference[*] usedByNodes

An infrastructure node may be used by other nodes that make use of its infrastructure-related capabilities.

Note

The “usedByNodes” attribute models the dependency of another node on an infrastructure node. The dependsOnNodes takes the opposite perspective and reflects the dependency of an infrastructure node on another node.

IntermediateInfrastructureTechnologyReference[1] reference

Intermediate representation of the reference to the infrastructure technology being used by the infrastructure node.

IntermediateOperationModel[1] operationModel

The operation model to which the infrastructure node belongs.

class IntermediateOperationNodeReference¶

This class represents a reference to an operation node.

String imported

This flag indicates whether the operation node reference is imported from another operation model or located in the same operation model where it occurs.

String name

Name of the referenced operation node.

String qualifiedTechnologyName

Name of the referenced operation node’s technology.

IntermediateImport import

In case the operation node is imported, this attribute points to the IntermediateImport instance, which identifies the imported model to which the node belongs.

IntermediateOperationNode dependsOnNode

Link to the operation node, which depends on the referenced operation node.

IntermediateOperationNode usedByNode

Link to the operation node, which uses the referenced operation node.

3.3 Operation Technologies¶

class IntermediateOperationTechnology¶

Abstract super class for operation technologies.

String[1] name

Name of the operation technology.

IntermediateOperationEnvironment[1] environment

The IntermediateOperationEnvironment of the technology.

IntermediateTechnologySpecificProperty[*] properties

Technology-specific properties provided by the operation technology.

class IntermediateOperationEnvironment¶

The operation environment of a certain operation technology. Operation environments may refer to technology that is mandatory to execute modeled operation nodes with its defining operation technology. For example, an operation environment may identify a the version or peculiarity of a capability of a certain operation technology.

String[1] environmentName

The name of the operation environment.

Boolean[1] default

Flag to indicate whether this is the default operation environment of an operation technology or not.

IntermediateOperationTechnology[1] operationTechnology

The operation technology to which this environment belongs.

class IntermediateTechnologySpecificProperty¶

A property of a certain operation technology.

String[1] name

The name of the property.

String[1] type

Name of the primitive type of the property. This can be one of the values:

  • “boolean”

  • “byte”

  • “char”

  • “date”

  • “double”

  • “float”

  • “int”

  • “long”

  • “short”

  • “string”

Note

A property cannot be of the built-in primitive type unspecified.

String defaultValue

If the property has a default value, it is encoded in this String attribute. However, it is guaranteed that the default value fits the type of the property.

String[*] featureNames

This attribute contains the names of all features specified for the property. The following values are possible:

Feature Name

Description

MANDATORY

Flag to indicate if the property needs to receive a value. It is guaranteed by the validator of the Operation Modeling Language that all mandatory values of a property receive a value.

SINGE_VALUED

Flag to indicate that a property may only receive a value once, which is guaranteed by the validator of the Operation Modeling Language.
IntermediateOperationTechnology operationTechnology

The operation technology to which the property belongs.

class IntermediateDeploymentTechnology¶

A concrete operation technology that represents a deployment technology.

IntermediateDeploymentTechnologyReference[1] reference

The IntermediateDeploymentTechnologyReference that points to this deployment technology.

class IntermediateDeploymentTechnologyReference¶

A reference to a deployment technology.

IntermediateImport[1] import

The import of the technology model, which defines the referenced deployment technology.

IntermediateDeploymentTechnology[1] technology

The referenced deployment technology.

IntermediateContainer[1] container

The IntermediateContainer that uses the deployment technology.

class IntermediateInfrastructureTechnology¶

A concrete operation technology that represents an infrastructure technology.

IntermediateInfrastructureTechnologyReference[1] reference

The IntermediateInfrastructureTechnologyReference that points to this infrastructure technology.

class IntermediateInfrastructureTechnologyReference¶

A reference to an infrastructure technology.

IntermediateImport[1] import

The import of the technology model, which defines the referenced infrastructure technology.

IntermediateInfrastructureTechnology[1] technology

The referenced infrastructure technology.

IntermediateInfrastructureNode[1] infrastructureNode

The IntermediateInfrastructureNode that uses the infrastructure technology.

3.4 Service Deployment Specifications¶

class IntermediateServiceDeploymentSpecification¶

Specification of a microservice’s deployment/usage of an operation node.

OperationMicroserviceReference[1] operationMicroserviceReference

The microservice targeted by the specification.

IntermediateOperationEndpoint[*] endpoints

Specific endpoints for the microservice.

IntermediateTechnologySpecificPropertyValue[*] propertyValues

Configuration values specific to the microservice.

IntermediateOperationNode[1] operationNode

The operation node to which the microservice is assigned.

class OperationMicroserviceReference¶

Reference to a microservice imported from an Intermediate Service Model (cf. Table 1). The concept extends the java:type:service_model:MicroserviceReference from the Intermediate Service Model specification and adds information relevant to Intermediate Operation Models.

Boolean[1] effectivelyImplemented

The effectivelyImplemented flag of the referenced microservice.

String[1] microserviceType

The type of the referenced microservice.

String[1] visibility

The visibility of the referenced microservice.

IntermediateOperationNode[1] node

The java:type`IntermediateOperationNode` to which the referenced microservice is deployed or that it used by the microservice.
